pr_title: Milestone 1 part 1 Initializing literallyCanvas and adding the required backend changes
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of N/A.
2. This PR does the following: Adds the backend validations for the Svgeditor rte and initializes the literallyCanvas without the saving functionality.
Note: The saving functionality will be introduced in the next part of the milestone.
[demo.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/4673607/demo.zip)


Package | Size (minified) | Size (gzipped)
-- | -- | --
react | 6.5 kb [source](https://unpkg.com/browse/react@16.1.1/umd/) | 2.7 kb [source](https://minime.stephan-brumme.com/react/16.1.1/)
react-dom | 94 kb [source](https://unpkg.com/browse/react-dom@16.1.1/umd/) | 29.9 kb [source](http://elijahmanor.com/react-file-size/)
create-react-class | 7.19 kb [source](https://unpkg.com/browse/create-react-class@15.6.2/) | 2.7 kb [source](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11008603/82834540-11b21300-9edf-11ea-8fb9-b7a4cc7c5850.png)
react-dom-factories | 3 kb [source](https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/react-dom-factories) | 1.4 kb [source](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11008603/82834540-11b21300-9edf-11ea-8fb9-b7a4cc7c5850.png)







## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [ ] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 9, 24, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429834203, 'comment_body': 'This won't work, sorry -- we don't allow construction of html in JS, and definitely not with "+" concatenation, since it is vulnerable to programming errors leading to security holes. E.g. maybe somehow shapeId has `</rect></svg><script src="evil.com">` in it. /cc @marianazangrossi 

I think you'll need to create a rect element and use e.g. jQuery to add attributes to it, or something like that. Make sure to add unit tests for sanitization (try using "bad" shapeIDs and ensure they are correctly escaped when the tag is produced.

Ditto elsewhere.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 9, 29, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429836989, 'comment_body': '"directive" is misspelled, here and above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 9, 35, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429839019, 'comment_body': "In the assets/literallyCanvas files below, there are a bunch of images. 'vojtechjelinek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429922780, 'comment_body': "Literally Canvas  does not include react by its own. I have verified it by trying to include only literallycanvas and it gave an error stating the react can't be found. This error was resolved once I installed react.
React - 127KB
ReactDom - 1.3MB
React-dom-factories - 7.7KB
create-react-class - 82.1KB", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 13, 1, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429964521, 'comment_body': 'Are these sizes after the files are minified and gzipped, if not could you please provide these? Also, this is quite a lot for one library, are there any other alternatives?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 14, 29, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'vojtechjelinek', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429980808, 'comment_body': "Here's what I found for react and react-dom:
Package | Size (minified) | Size (gzipped)
------------ | ------------- | -------------
react | 6.5 kb ([source](https://unpkg.com/browse/react@16.1.1/umd/)) | 2.7 kb ([source](https://minime.stephan-brumme.com/react/16.1.1/))
react-dom | 94 kb ([source](https://unpkg.com/browse/react-dom@16.1.1/umd/)) | 29.9 kb ([source](http://elijahmanor.com/react-file-size/))

Not sure about the other packages. @rohitkatlaa can you check? Also, can you double-check if literallycanvas actually requires the other packages to work?

Also, among the suggested installation method for literallycanvas [here](https://github.com/literallycanvas/literallycanvas-demos), are we using the npm_webpack method? The description seems to fit our project.

@vojtechjelinek, per @rohitkatlaa's proposal there does not seem to be good alternatives. This package is simple, configurable, and has great browser support. React is the only dependency for this and I think it is reasonable (considering that the package sizes are quite small for the main packages react & react-dom -- I don't think the others are required but @rohitkatlaa  to confirm).

Update: Added gzipped sizes too.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 15, 4, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430017574, 'comment_body': 'I have checked and confirmed that LiterallyCanvas requires both create-react-class and react-dom-factories. 
https://github.com/literallycanvas/literallycanvas/issues/505', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 16, 51, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430024001, 'comment_body': "Package | Size (minified)

react-dom-factories | 3 kb ([source](https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/react-dom-factories)) 

I wasn't able to find the gzipped version, I will update if I find it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 17, 15, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430034342, 'comment_body': 'Based on the source you provided, these are the gzipped sizes.
![sizes_nobg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11008603/82834540-11b21300-9edf-11ea-8fb9-b7a4cc7c5850.png)

Package | Size (gzipped)
-- | -- 
create-react-class | 2.7 kb
react-dom-factories | 1.4 kb


(see "transferred over the network" values)

Can you add all this info in the description of the PR please?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 17, 58, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430037053, 'comment_body': 'I have added all the information to the description of the PR.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 18, 8, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430037199, 'comment_body': 'And thank you for explaining me about the gzipped files.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 25, 18, 9, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430170233, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 53, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430170270, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 53, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430170968, 'comment_body': "Since literallyCanvas opens in a modal, there can't be multiple lc ids. But however I have solved the issue by using a random id that is unique to a particular component if we decide to use multiple literallyCanvas outside the modal.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 55, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430170986, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171013, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171041, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171078, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171104, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171129, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171258, 'comment_body': 'I have used the document to create svg tags and also added validations for it. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 56, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171294, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 57, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171504, 'comment_body': 'I have added literallyCanvas in the third party library from which we can access the images. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 57, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171567, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 57, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430171629, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 5, 57, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430232820, 'comment_body': 'Great, thanks for adding this test!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 8, 12, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430233610, 'comment_body': 'Should widht be width?

Also, given this -- is it possible to get a better indication of why it failed? For all you know, it could have failed due to widht not being an allowed attr. I think the best thing to do here is to create a tag that is as simple as possible but is still valid, add an expectation that it is valid, then modify it slightly to make it bad, and add an expectation that the new form is bad. That way you can be confident that the badness is due to what changed between the two versions.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 8, 13, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430234405, 'comment_body': 'General question: Should you be throwing any error in case of non-validity? If not, how will the creator know?

Ditto elsewhere.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 8, 14, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430234725, 'comment_body': 'Same comments as before re using "(" and indentation. (Please follow them for future PRs.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 8, 15, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430235241, 'comment_body': 'Could you please clarify what "once data is saved" means? Do you mean "once the functionality for saving XXX is implemented"?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 8, 16, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430235386, 'comment_body': 'is --> are

pr_title: Add svg editor using fabric js and replace literallyCanvas
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA
2. This PR does the following: This PR removes literallyCanvas and adds fabric js as the editor.
This [Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_F5GNfBDRiS4R7CXzxEdMpcf_PVo15sgF3cQvxnxe_0/edit?usp=sharing) discusses the alternatives for literallyCanvas.

vanilla-picker is an additional library used to create input box for colors with alpha. It is not a dependency for fabric js.


Edit:
## Icons used
The svg files are got from the following free source.
Line : https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/diagonal-line_109604
Pencil: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/pencil_598234
Rectangle: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/rectangle_650139
Circle: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/rec_808569
Text: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/text_2905166
Eye Dropper: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/eye-dropper_2491513
Undo: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/back-arrow_340
Redo: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/redo-arrow_1523

Package | Size (minified) | Gzipped
-- | -- | --
fabric js| 302 kb [source](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/fabric.js/3.6.3/fabric.min.js) | 120B 
vanilla-picker | 20.01 kb [source](https://unpkg.com/vanilla-picker@2.10.1/dist/vanilla-picker.min.js) | 95B




![fabric js editor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/85208046-f9e97580-b34a-11ea-98f6-f04709918697.gif)

Edit:
Updated UI using font awesome icons:

![Screenshot from 2020-06-21 18-17-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/85225413-a9c3ef00-b3ee-11ea-8035-0ac1127b4a23.png)


## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

pr_title: Milestone-1.3 and 1.4 add saving and editing functionality to svg editor
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of N/A.
2. This PR does the following: This PR adds the saving and editing functionality to the svg editor.
![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/83935924-ce5b7c80-a7db-11ea-9f85-f5639e77071b.gif)

Closes #9357 

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

So, maybe instead of this a custom type for `NameNodeMap` should be declared in the `typings` directory which would have the properties which are used here. Similar to what we do for `ng.IScope` in some controllers. For example
https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/d12d515d0b65c0aaf126fd17e2ef62fbf44c158d/core/templates/components/ck-editor-helpers/ck-editor-4-rte.directive.ts#L30-L32", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 8, 21, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437013279, 'comment_body': "The ts compiler expects a function exactly similar to `JQuery.ajax` here. So, I think it's fine to use `@ts-ignore` here.

/cc @vojtechjelinek @ankita240796 ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 8, 21, 31, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437087728, 'comment_body': "Does this message need to be made more informative? I'm not sure. Adding @kevintab95 for a decision.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 1, 30, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437088075, 'comment_body': "Per @nishantwrp's [comment](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/9445#discussion_r437008885), we shouldn't  be using ts-ignore here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 1, 32, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437088222, 'comment_body': "Why don't you just keep the function definition here?

If that's not possible, then maybe prefix the inner function with _.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 1, 32, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437089365, 'comment_body': 'There is too much duplication between these lines and those below. Please find a way to reduce it.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 1, 37, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437117453, 'comment_body': "Just to give additional information regarding the error. Since the svg's are generated by literallyCanvas the chance of invalid svg being generated is zero unless someone tampers with it. So I believe that the error will never be invoked.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 3, 28, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437119864, 'comment_body': "OK, thanks. My comment still applies. If we don't expect it to happen in practice, then having more info seems even more important, so that we can debug it if it does happen.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 3, 38, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437433254, 'comment_body': "Per discussion with @rohitkatlaa, we'll be logging the tags and attrs as well here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 13, 48, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437459235, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 18, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437460716, 'comment_body': 'As I have mentioned [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/9445#discussion_r436263533). It causes problems when I mention it there so I have used _. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 20, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437460835, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 20, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437460937, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 20, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437462364, 'comment_body': 'This is not needed since these typings are not for this lib. Also maybe change the name of this file to custom-hash-node-map-defs.d.ts or something similar', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 22, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437463211, 'comment_body': 'newline', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 23, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437464006, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
          (<CustomHashNodeMap> rect.attributes).fill.value);
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 24, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437464106, 'comment_body': 'ditto', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 24, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437464208, 'comment_body': 'ditto', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 9, 14, 24, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nishantwrp', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437849342, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 10, 4, 12, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437849374, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 10, 4, 12, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437849408, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 10, 4, 12, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437849429, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 10, 4, 12, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437849456, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 10, 4, 12, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 437936457, 'comment_body': 'Misspelled "invalid", here and elsewhere. pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes #9492 .
2. This PR does the following: It removes the setTimeout functions which caused the flakiness and It mocks the Image and FileReader classes.

## Essential Checklist

- [X] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If thisx PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

I don't understand...", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 13, 16, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'nithusha21', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 439753839, 'comment_body': 'That comment explains the reason why a ts-ignore is used. The mock image object does not contain all the properties of image so ts leaves an error. So in order to ignore that the @ ts-ignore is used.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 13, 17, 10, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Add svg editor using fabric js and replace literallyCanvas
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA
2. This PR does the following: This PR removes literallyCanvas and adds fabric js as the editor.
This [Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_F5GNfBDRiS4R7CXzxEdMpcf_PVo15sgF3cQvxnxe_0/edit?usp=sharing) discusses the alternatives for literallyCanvas.

vanilla-picker is an additional library used to create input box for colors with alpha. It is not a dependency for fabric js.


Edit:
## Icons used
The svg files are got from the following free source.
Line : https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/diagonal-line_109604
Pencil: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/pencil_598234
Rectangle: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/rectangle_650139
Circle: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/rec_808569
Text: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/text_2905166
Eye Dropper: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/eye-dropper_2491513
Undo: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/back-arrow_340
Redo: https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/redo-arrow_1523

Package | Size (minified) | Gzipped
-- | -- | --
fabric js| 302 kb [source](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/fabric.js/3.6.3/fabric.min.js) | 120B 
vanilla-picker | 20.01 kb [source](https://unpkg.com/vanilla-picker@2.10.1/dist/vanilla-picker.min.js) | 95B




![fabric js editor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/85208046-f9e97580-b34a-11ea-98f6-f04709918697.gif)

Edit:
Updated UI using font awesome icons:

![Screenshot from 2020-06-21 18-17-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/85225413-a9c3ef00-b3ee-11ea-8035-0ac1127b4a23.png)


## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

pr_title: Add e2e tests to svg editor rte
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA
2. This PR does the following: It adds the e2e tests for the svgdiagram rte component and also adds two more tools i.e bring forward and send backward which changes the overlapping of objects. It also removes the flag that was hiding svg diagram rte.

Edit: 
10 Screenshots of e2e tests.
[e2e screenshots.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/4857321/e2e.screenshots.zip)
5 Circle CI e2e tests screenshots
[circle ci screenshots.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/4873055/circle.ci.screenshots.zip)



## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

[{'comment_id': 448187126, 'comment_body': 'Use objectIsSelected instead. We generally prefix `is` to functions.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 1, 8, 1, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 448187994, 'comment_body': 'Why are we doing this?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 1, 8, 3, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 448265695, 'comment_body': "When drawing a polygon, the initial lines uses stroke color. So if the alpha is zero you won't see the initial diagram, So Iam forcing it to 1 until the polygon is complete. So once the polygon is complete it retains the actual value.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 1, 10, 20, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 448266350, 'comment_body': 'I will add a comment in the code.
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 1, 10, 21, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 448267306, 'comment_body': 'Sounds good. Thanks!

In general, it's always good to add a comment if you get a comment asking why something is the way it is. See tip [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#instructions-for-making-a-code-change):
>Tip: If a reviewer asks questions about the "why" behind something, consider proactively adding a clear comment above the relevant line in your code, since the fact that the reviewer had to ask suggests that at least one developer doesn't understand what is going on from the code alone. pr_title: Svg diagram editor rte bug fixes
pr_body:
1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA
2. This PR does the following:
- Fixes canvas dimensions issue when editing.
- Changes background of color picker to pixels.
- Changes the information text from red color to black color.
- Fixes the textbox resize issue.

![ezgif com-video-to-gif (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/86354186-3049bd80-bc86-11ea-9d72-6e141e40a267.gif)


## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

pr_title: Add pie chart tool to svg editor
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA.
2. This PR does the following: This PR adds the pie chart tool to the svg editor. I have attached a gif file and a video file of the functionality. 
![pie chart](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/88803847-b3e5c400-d1ca-11ea-8f3f-e0c7f007a12e.gif)
[pie chart.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/4995013/pie.chart.zip)

Edit: 
Circle ci e2e tests screenshots
[circle ci screenshots.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/5005975/circle.ci.screenshots.zip)


## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

pr_title: Add import svg tool to svg editor
pr_body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA.
2. This PR does the following: It adds a svg import tool to the svg editor. The svg can be imported as a single group or as individual shapes. This is illustrated in the video and gif.

![upload svg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42460632/89552528-e4140f00-d829-11ea-8361-156d486598e4.gif)
[upload svg tool.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/5036029/upload.svg.tool.zip)

Circle CI screenshots
[circle ci screenshots.zip](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/files/5067000/circle.ci.screenshots.zip)



## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [X] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [X] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [X] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.

It seems that a reasonable way to configure an "image uploader" is to specify what image types are allowed.

However, if you want to do this, you should do it fully: pass in allowedImageTypes everywhere and have it represent a list. Maybe declare a constant list in constants.ts or somewhere and use that for the majority of the editors.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 8, 2, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 467379435, 'comment_body': 'Just a note -- I think we prefer isDrawModeSvgUpload(), we treat other acronyms similarly. Maybe fix throughout?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 8, 3, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 467379982, 'comment_body': 'I have no idea what is going on, sorry. From a user perspective, what is the difference between the two options? If you could explain that clearly I could maybe try to advise on how to shorten it.

(In particular I do not understand what "grouping" means.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 8, 4, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 467407213, 'comment_body': 'Based on previous discussion with @rohitkatlaa, there are two ways for the editor to treat a newly imported SVG, it can either interpret it as individual shapes that make up the image or treat it as an indivisible group. The former gives the user freedom to take apart the image or modify it freely (as if it were created entirely in the editor). The latter just allows resizing of the image. You can see these two scenarios demonstrated in the description of this PR (https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/10182#issue-464110698).

@rohitkatlaa did I get that right?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 9, 1, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 467408421, 'comment_body': 'Then perhaps: "Load as Single Image" vs "Load as Individual Shapes"?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 9, 4, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 467416298, 'comment_body': '@kevintab95 Yes you got it correct. In the meantime, since the e2e tests are already so flaky, we want to make sure that any new code is written as well as possible to avoid making things any worse. Not checking that elements have loaded before interacting with them is also one of the most common problems we see on PRs. This is related to the property passed to the <image-uploader> tag. So the suggested statement is not be accurate.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 46, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471065206, 'comment_body': 'That is because only one image type is allowed in here i.e the svg.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 52, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471065286, 'comment_body': "I am sorry for not noticing such a simple mistake, now I have fixed it. I had tested it in other places using png and not jpeg so I didn't realise the problem.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 53, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471065294, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 53, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471065303, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 53, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471065308, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 16, 4, 53, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471227381, 'comment_body': 'Just to check, have you tested the image-uploader directive with images of different formats listed here?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 4, 36, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471227396, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
            imageHasInvalidFormat = (
```

ditto below.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 4, 37, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471229031, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 4, 44, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471229161, 'comment_body': "I didn't check for all image types before but now I have checked it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 4, 45, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471353427, 'comment_body': 'Use hasOwnProperty instead', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 9, 25, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471354051, 'comment_body': 'Confusing to have fileType mean two different things -- please pick a different name for the dummy var.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 9, 26, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471354774, 'comment_body': "What if it's inconsistent -- e.g. the format is valid, and the extension is valid, but both these validity cases correspond to different elements in the dict?

Probably you should have just one boolean, not two independent ones.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 9, 27, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471355369, 'comment_body': 'The naming is still off and should be fixed -- ctrl.imageType should be a list with one element and should be changed to ctrl.allowedImageFormats perhaps.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 9, 28, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471388938, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 10, 32, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471388994, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 10, 32, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471389048, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 10, 32, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471389166, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 10, 32, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471536336, 'comment_body': 'We restrict thumbnail uploads to SVG. In that case, should we pass only SVG as the allowed format here?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 14, 56, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471538908, 'comment_body': 'Maybe this should be plural because this is a list (even though it contains only one item). What do you think?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 14, 59, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471543683, 'comment_body': 'svg -> SVG
We generally use all-caps for acronyms.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471544284, 'comment_body': 'Hm, can you point me to where `far` is defined?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 7, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471550764, 'comment_body': 'What happens if, one of the "imageType" in the list has a valid format and the next one is invalid? According to this code, it looks like this boolean will still be set to false when it should be true.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 17, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471557511, 'comment_body': '```far``` is a part of font-awesome styles.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 27, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471558977, 'comment_body': 'In that case the uploaded image is actually valid but the error will also be flagged.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 29, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471560647, 'comment_body': 'Ah I see. Thanks for explaining.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 32, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471562357, 'comment_body': 'I have changed it to allow only svg. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 34, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471562776, 'comment_body': 'I have changed it to allowedImageFormats. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 35, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471562845, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 35, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471567685, 'comment_body': 'Ah, I see. Do you think it would make sense to mention the imageType that is invalid in the error string?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 42, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'kevintab95', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471571602, 'comment_body': 'Yes I think it would make sense to add the invalid imageType. Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 17, 15, 48, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471896470, 'comment_body': 'I still don't understand what is going on here. Why do we need to check that file.type matches both "format" and "fileType"? Can these be collapsed into a single regex/check?

Don't just follow the previous code blindly. Try to understand the logic.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 18, 3, 46, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471900469, 'comment_body': 'Done.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 18, 4, 2, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471901690, 'comment_body': 'Please explain, in detail, the logic behind your reasoning to remove the regex you removed, and why doing so does not change the definition of "validity".', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 18, 4, 8, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'seanlip', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 471906689, 'comment_body': "The current condition for file format is not a regex and it is direct string matching which is more concrete. Initially I thought that the addition check was done for a particular reason but now I think that it was redundant code. So I think that removing it won't reduce the validity check.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 18, 4, 29, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rohitkatlaa', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 475213862, 'comment_body': "@rohitkatlaa just FYI, you can use '<' instead of '@'. If you do this, you don't have to JSON.stringify and JSON.parse. You can directly pass variables.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 23, 12, 32, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'srijanreddy98', 'type': 'User'}]

## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of NA.
2. This PR does the following: 
This PR updates the fabric js version from 3.6 to 4.1. The new version removed the function trigger(which was used only in frontend test). So I instead used ```fire``` function which has similar functionality. 
The e2e svg had to be changed because of version change.
There was minor bug related to the pie chart tool which is also fixed in this PR.

## Essential Checklist

- [ ] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The linter/Karma presubmit checks have passed locally on your machine.
- [x] "Allow edits from maintainers" is checked. (See [here](https://help.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-issues-and-pull-requests/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork) for instructions on how to enable it.)
  - This lets reviewers restart your CircleCI tests for you.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".

## PR Pointers

- Oppiabot will notify you when you don't add a PR_CHANGELOG label. If you are unable to do so, please @-mention a code owner (who will be in the Reviewers list), or ask on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/oppia/oppia-chat).
- For what code owners will expect, see the [Code Owner's wiki page](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Oppia%27s-code-owners-and-checks-to-be-carried-out-by-developers).
- Make sure your PR follows conventions in the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Coding-style-guide), otherwise this will lead to review delays
- Never force push. If you do, your PR will be closed.
